trans-unit.source: Hosts a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref> that displays items that overflow the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref>.

If there are more overflow items than can be displayed on the form, use the [ToolStrip Items Collection Editor](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/e681f3ab-94ba-4b2b-ac64-1dfad46caa25) to manage this situation.
Creates a new accessibility object for the control.

If you do not explicitly call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripOverflowButton.CreateAccessibilityInstance%2A> method, it will be called when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.AccessibilityObject%2A> property is referenced.

To get or set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.AccessibilityObject%2A> property, you must add a reference to the `Accessibility` assembly installed with the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
A new <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject"></xref> for the control.
Creates an empty <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref> that can be dropped down and to which events can be attached.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref> control.
Gets the space, in pixels, that is specified by default between controls.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Padding"></xref> value representing the space between controls.

Called by the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Component.Dispose(System.Boolean)"></xref> and <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Component.Finalize"></xref> methods to release the managed and unmanaged resources used by the current instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripOverflowButton"></xref> class.
This method is called only by the public <xref:System.ComponentModel.Component.Dispose%2A> and <xref:System.ComponentModel.Component.Finalize%2A> methods; do not call this method directly.
When you implement the dispose pattern, the <xref:System.Boolean> parameter of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripOverflowButton.Dispose%2A> method should be used as follows:

The <xref:System.ComponentModel.Component.Dispose> method of the current object should call <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripOverflowButton.Dispose%2A> with the <xref:System.Boolean> parameter set to `true` to release both managed and unmanaged resources.

The <xref:System.ComponentModel.Component.Finalize%2A> method of the current object should call <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripOverflowButton.Dispose%2A> with the <xref:System.Boolean> parameter set to `false` to release only unmanaged resources.
For more information, see [Implementing a Dispose Method](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md).
`true` to release managed and unmanaged resources; `false` to release only unmanaged resources.
Retrieves the size of a rectangular area into which a control can fit.
The custom-sized area for a control.
An ordered pair of type <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref> representing the width and height of a rectangle.
Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripOverflowButton"></xref> has items that overflow the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref>.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripOverflowButton"></xref> has overflow items; otherwise, `false`.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripOverflowButton.OnPaint%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
This property is not relevant to this class.
This property is not relevant to this class.
`true` to enable automatic mirroring; otherwise, `false`.
Sets the size and location of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripOverflowButton"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> representing the size and location of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripOverflowButton"></xref>.
